definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: Our Stone Age ancestors certainly did not live in a feedlot.
sentences.chinese: 我们石器时代的祖先当然没有生活在饲养场。

sentences.english: Wow- you reficisly live in the Stone Age.
sentences.chinese: 哇，你真的还生活在石器时代。

sentences.english: That time was the Stone Age.
It was clear right away this was a gigantic Stone Age site.
sentences.chinese: 很明显这是一个巨大的石器时代的遗迹。

sentences.english: We are developing a bomb-them-back-into-the-Stone-Age weapon.
sentences.chinese: 我们正在开发一种把他们炸回石器时代的武器。

sentences.english: So how can we know anything about life in Stone Age Europe?
sentences.chinese: 所以，我们如何了解石器时代欧洲的人类生活呢？

sentences.english: The history of breaststroke goes back to the Stone Age.
sentences.chinese: 蛙泳的起源可以追溯到石器时代。

sentences.english: BCE 500.000 during the Stone Age there was a man-type of ape living in Mongolia.
sentences.chinese: 公元前50万年，石器时代，类人猿在蒙古地区生活。

sentences.english: Paintings from the Stone Age show early musical instruments.
sentences.chinese: 从石器时代的画中我们可以见到早期乐器的模样。

sentences.english: Remember the Stone Age days of research back in elementary school and middle school?
sentences.chinese: 还记得上小学和中学时那种石器时代的研究方法吗？

sentences.english: That is why no ancient boats have been found in the archaeological studies of the Stone Age in China.
sentences.chinese: 所以在我国石器时代的考古中尚未发现有古老的舟船。

sentences.english: After that,the Stone Age family always cooked their food on the fire.
sentences.chinese: 在那之后，石器时代家庭总是在火上煮他们的食品。

sentences.english: Wow- you reficisly live in the Stone Age- Mom.
sentences.chinese: 哇，妈妈，你还生活在石器时代。

definition: the Bronze Age/also written 青銅時代|青铜时代[Qing1 tong2 Shi2 dai4]
ancient hominid species such as Homo erectus, Neanderthal man etc
Yangshao neolithic culture from the central Yellow river basin, with red and black pottery
Dawenkou culture (c. 4100-2600 BC), Neolithic culture based in today's Shandong area 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
